entry.title: OS13
entry.content:
关于OS13的一点感想这一篇我想写给身为二本学生的我，这里开诚布公将心比心前几天把上学期期末考试考完了，我OS几乎交了白卷
How ridiculous i am ！现在我已经没有那个心气刷那些自以为是的小聪明了，大学两年，毫无收获前前后后写了又都删了，好像这个头不好起，那就简单说一下新路历程吧，写着写着就好写了，刚上大学，内心充满着无数的憧憬，可是，来了这里，你会发现和你想的有些差距，接下来我要讲的是我的故事，我现在清楚的记得第一天的中午8个舍友到了5个，一起吃的麻辣香锅，我给一个舍友 说，哎，咱们建个群吧，以后方便联系，（我想当宿舍长，但是我又有些担忧，就开了个头然后说我不知道怎么建群，你建吧，然后群主是他的，后来他也成了宿舍长）吃了中午饭，没有高中老师让你午休了，舍友有的午休，有的不午休，我就躺在床上躺着，下午或者晚上，看着大家打王者，突然我好像缺了魂，我到现在都记得那个感觉，算不上迷茫，算不上惆怅，我木讷了，不知道要感谢什么，自己一个人也不敢出去转转校园，我拿起手机，偷偷的拍了几张照片，我也忘记了那个晚上怎么睡着了，大家都是普通家庭的普通孩子，被家长送到学校，还有家长的嘱托，我现在想起姥爷的话，好好学习，吃得苦中苦，方为人上人，逢人只说三分话，不可全抛一片心，好像我都没有做到，我还是那么幼稚，自作聪明，看过一句话“有时候我们必须闭上嘴，放下骄傲，承认自己错了，这不是认输，而是成长”我可能在家里和我妈顶嘴顶惯了，不肯承认自己的错误好像是我现在仍然存在的一个毛病，关于宿舍关系，我曾经想过一个“黔驴困境”，就是黔驴如何摆脱最后被老虎吃掉的结局，我曾经想过黔驴被吃有两个关键要素，1是黔驴技穷2是老虎知道驴“技止此耳”，所以解决办法有两种1是勤学苦练，技压老虎就可以打败老虎了2是与老虎保持距离，要知道驴刚到黔地，老虎是不敢靠近黔驴的，只要和老虎保持适当的保持距离，老虎摸不清黔驴的底牌，大概也许就能逃离虎口吧，而这两点我都没能做到，于是被老虎分而食之，这两年大抵就是这样过来的吧，那句形容二本学生的话好像就是我的写照，间接性踌躇满志，持续性混吃等死，总是太幼稚，整个人浮在空中飘来飘去，从手机上说上大学不要听老师念ppt，大学培养的是自学能力，而我听话好像只听了一半，我的表现是觉得老师教的不好，mooc上985211老师讲课比这强一百倍，好高骛远，眼高手低成为了我的学习常态，时至今日我也没有把mooc上任何一门课刷完，而学校老师的课我不去听，嫌他没水平，可是我忘记了适合自己的才是最好的，所以我需要做的就是慢慢把心静下来，世间一切都是我的老师，而保持对老师的尊敬，对自己负责才是最重要的，

哦，我突然想起到高三复习的时候遇到的一个生物老师，是个小老头，教我们c班，有一次我和一个复习生去问问题：“老师，您帮我看一”话还没说完，老师就说：“去去去，我没空儿，我还有课呢”，我愣了一下，说：“老师，你给我讲讲吧，就这个题，我觉得应该…”然后老师（带个眼镜）从眼镜儿上方歪着看了我一眼，说：“这不巴拉巴拉…昂”，然后和我一块去的那个同学，忘了叫什么了，他说老师没给我讲，我就出来了他还说以后再也不找他问题去了，时至今日我也感谢那个老师）

曾经的我做什么事情，失败了，总是会给自己找一堆借口，这样是不好的，其实是自己没有全力以赴，只是口头上说说，什么是真正想要做事，程门立雪是，三顾茅庐是，如果刘备没有三顾茅庐诸葛亮，打天下失败了，能怨诸葛亮没帮他吗？不能，那怨谁？他自己呗，而如果一个人不从自身找理由，总是给自己找借口，哎呀，这不好，那不行，这是逃避，是懦弱，人家诸葛亮（生物老师）的内心也许说：这个傻小子，我就试试你，我拒绝你一次你就不不来了，看来你不是诚心诚意的，

反观《送东阳马生序》中宋濂的做法：”余立侍左右，援疑质理，俯身倾耳以请；或遇其叱咄，色愈恭，礼愈至，不敢出一言以复；俟其欣悦，则又请焉。故余虽愚，卒获有所闻。“我们现在的人太浮躁，太骄傲，做什么都要一个凭什么，可是很多事情是没有那么多凭什么的

关于OS13的一点感想这一篇我想写给身为二本学生的我，这里开诚布公将心比心前几天把上学期期末考试考完了，我OS几乎交了白卷
How ridiculous i am ！现在我已经没有那个心气刷那些自以为是的小聪明了，大学两年，毫无收获前前后后写了又都删了，好像这个头不好

entry.title: About 费曼
entry.content:
今天网上冲浪，在一篇PDF中，了解到一位曾经的学生对他的回忆，讲了费曼的一些特点：爱搞恶作剧mischief， 平易近人approachable等，费曼本人也出版过自传Surely You're Joking, Mr.Feynman!, 讲了关于他的一些anecdotes，最后作者提到了给他母亲留纸条的事情：

I have one last anecdote about Feynman. I include it not because it has any deep significance, though it does, I think, say something about him. It’s about the time he wrote to my mum.

In l982, the BBC screened a profile of Feynman in its Horizon series. My mother watched from beginning to end. Now, there’s nothing extraordinary about that, except that my mother had never shown interest in any science programme, or anything to do with science for that matter (I never have been able to explain to her satisfaction, why people in Australia don’t just fall off into space). However, later, when I was at Caltech, I had an idea. I would go to Feynman, explain that my mother had watched him on TV, and ask him whether he would help me out by dropping her a note. If he did, I reasoned naively, then perhaps the next time I tried to explain to my mother how we know that the Earth is round or the sky is blue, she might be more receptive.

There was something about Feynman that said he was approachable. I knew, though I had never met him, that he would not think my request a frivolous one. (What is it about some people, I wonder, that makes you feel, the minute you see them, that you know them?).

Anyhow, the upshot was that Feynman did drop my mother that note.

It said: “Dear Mrs Chown, Ignore your son’s attempts to teach you physics. ==Physics isn’t the most important thing. Love is==. Best wishes, Richard Feynman.”




What i cannot create, i do not understand. 了解更多

Know how to solve every problem that has been solved. 了解更多
entry.summary: 今天网上冲浪，在一篇

entry.title: How to read a paper
entry.content:
Taken from here

Three pass approch

The first pass

To get a bird's eye view of the paper(5-10 minutes)

  1. Carefully read the title, abstract, and introduction
  2. Read the section and sub-section heading, but ignore everything else
  3. Read the conclusions
  4. Glance over the references, mentally ticking off the ones you’ve already read

At the end of the first pass, you should be able to answer the five Cs:

  1. Category: What type of paper is this?
  2. Context: Which other papers is it related to? Which theoretical bases were used to analyze the problem?
  3. Correctness: Do the assumptions appear to be valid?
  4. Contributions: What are the paper’s main contributes?
  5. Clarity: Is the paper well written?

Then, choose whether to read further.

The second pass

Read the paper with greater care, but ignore details such as proofs.It helps to jot down the key points, or to make comments in the margins, as you read.(Take up to 1h.)

  1. Look carefully at the figures, diagrams and other illustration.
  2. Remember to mark relevant unread references for further reading.

After this pass, you should be able to grasp the content of the paper.

The third pass

Attempt to virtually re-implement the paper: making the same assumptions as the author, re-create the work.

By comparing the re-creation with the actual paper, you can easily identify not only a paper’s innovations, but also its hidden failings and assumptions.(4-5h→1h)

At the end of this pass, you should be able to reconstruct the entire structure of the paper from memory, as well as be able to identity its strong and weak points.

entry.title: 我用什么才能留住你？
entry.content:
What can i hold you with?

I offer you lean streets, desperate sunsets, the moon of the jagged suburbs.

I offer you the bitterness of a man who has looked long and long at the lonely moon.

I offer you my ancestors, my dead men, the ghost that living men have honoured in marble:

​ my father’s father killed in the frontier of Buenos Aires, two bullets through his lungs,bearded and dead, wrapped by his soldier in the hide of a cow;

​ my mother’s grandfather just twenty-four, heading a charge of three hundred men in Peru, now ghost on vanished horses.

I offer you whatever insight my books may hold, whatever manliness or humour my life.

I offer you the loyalty of a man who has never been loyal.

I offer you that kernel of myself that i have saved somehow the central heart that deals not in words, traffics not with dreams and is untouched by time, by joy, by adversities.

I offer you the memory of a yellow rose seen at sunset, years before you were born.

I offer you explanations of yourself, theories about yourself, authentic and surprising news of youself.

I can give you my loneliness, my darkness, the hunger of my heart;

I am trying to bribe you with uncertainty, with danger, with defeat.
entry.summary: What can i ho

entry.title: 摘山月记
entry.content: 我深怕自己并非美玉，故而不敢加以刻苦折磨，却又半信自己是块美玉，故又不肯庸庸碌碌，与瓦砾为伍。于是我渐渐地脱离凡尘，疏远世人，结果便是一任愤懑与羞恨日益助长内心那怯弱地自尊心。无非是害怕暴露自己才华不足之卑劣的恐惧和不肯刻苦用功的无耻之怠惰而已……

entry.title: 三界理论
entry.content:
达利曾经说过:靠芳香和谬误生活

弗洛伊德曾经说过:拉开帘子看看

而lacan说:拉了,后边什么都没有

达利就是用他的近乎痴狂不屈的意志和大他者永远的斗争着
